alert.note: Alert for Bottineau; Dickey; Foster; Kidder; La Moure; McHenry; Pierce; Rolette; Sheridan; Stutsman; Wells (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 24 at 1:42PM CST until December 26 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CST SUNDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO MIDNIGHT CST SUNDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills as low as 40 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Portions of central North Dakota, including the James River Valley. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 9 AM CST Sunday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from Midnight tonight to Midnight CST Sunday Night. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A brief period of mixed precipitation may produce a light glaze of ice accumulation for some areas on Sunday.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate winter clothing.

area.areaDesc: Bottineau; Dickey; Foster; Kidder; La Moure; McHenry; Pierce; Rolette; Sheridan; Stutsman; Wells
